topic.title: Exodus @ VT
topic.shortdesc: A semesterly K-pop dance showcase held in Haymarket Theatre.

body.p: While K-pop may not be everyone's thing, nobody can deny the talent of the dancers in the Exodus showcase, a group of students who work each semester to put on a K-pop dance show. Exodus choreographers work hard to learn dances to a selection of k-pop songs, hold auditions to cast dancers, and teach them all their parts in each dance. They rehearse a few hours a week, all leading up to their showcase towards the end of the semester.

fig.title: Exodus logo, from Exodus YouTube account

image.alt: The logo of "Exodus at Virginia Tech," featuring the club's name in bright neon letters within a geometric design reminiscent of k-pop album covers.

fig.title: Exodus workshop advertisement, from Exodus Instagram

body.p: Exodus is an opportunity for people who haven't had a chance to dance before to learn exciting dances to songs they love. The theatre is always packed with friends and family, cheering for the dancers, and people dress up in styles reminiscent of k-pop artists. Many of these dancers are incredibly talented, and even those who never danced before hold their own incredibly well and seem to have a good time.
If you like k-pop or dance in general, you should be sure to check out the Exodus showcase. It's free, though you can contribute to the Exodus fundraiser by buying roses for dancers.
